title: What if the Government mixed two Chemicals and destroyed the Planet instantly?
body:
"What if the Government didn't mix two Chemicals and missed out on creating almost infinite Energy?"

Obviously almost infinite Energy is more important than the Planet.

You keep mixing those Chemicals you have no idea what does and risk our lives daily so you can get us a better quality of life.

Being blown to Jupiter in two seconds is obviously good for your Health.

Keep up dem experiments.

Good job Governments.

replies.body:
We might need infinite Energy someday though. To perpetuate the Planets survival.

You win Governments.

Forgiveness in Advance for the T-Virus.

We have it, it is called the sun, also a russian scientist called tesla actually created a source of infinite power but the government shut it down because they wanted to make money. Then they got rid of the evidence.

Because government controls experiments. Not to mention that you have a general idea of the outcome before performing an experiment.

Terrible bait kid go back to class.

Why do an experiment if you know what it's going to do? Lol.

Well if they say no to you doing it, you're not allowed to do it and they take part in many of their own experiments. I'd call that a major element of control however I'm sure there are clandestine experiments taking place and many they don't even so much as look at.

Makes you wonder what goes on unseen though...
